name: Tribal Economic Development Bonds
objective: The baseline tax system generally would tax all income under the regular tax rate schedule. It would not allow preferentially low (or zero) tax rates to apply to certain types or sources of income. In contrast, the Tax Code was modified in 2009 to allow Indian tribal governments to issue tax exempt “tribal economic development bonds.” There is a national bond limitation of $2 billion on such bonds.
categories: Tax Expenditures - Community and Regional Development
